2. Staff Directory

Al Rodriguez
============

[City Council](https://www.elgintexas.gov/Directory.aspx?DID=4)  
Title: City Council Member, Ward 3
  
[Email](mailto:al.rodriguez@elgintexas.gov)

  
  

![](https://www.elgintexas.gov/ImageRepository/Document?documentId=7374)

Mr. Rodriguez was elected to the City Council of Elgin in May 2022. He has lived in Elgin most of his professional career and currently serves the Elgin Independent School District as the Executive Director of Communications and Community Engagement. He has been employed with Elgin ISD for almost 30 years and his career in Public Education includes all grade levels K-12, district administration & leadership, campus administration & leadership, and classroom experience. He has previously served as the Assistant Superintendent of Human Capital, Executive Director and Director of Human Resources, Principal, Assistant Principal, Teacher and Substitute Teacher. Mr. Rodriguez also served with the Texas Education Agency for various initiatives including the Texas School Improvement Initiative helping to audit Texas school districts. Additionally, he worked with the Stupski Foundation’s Knowledge and Assessment Team assessing systems and processes from finances to curriculum to governance, in large urban districts nationwide while he was a member of The University of Texas at Austin’s Cooperative Superintendency / Educational Administration Program.

Mr. Rodriguez is a native Texan. He graduated from A.N. McCallum High School in Austin before attending Texas Tech University where he received his Bachelor of Science degree in Biology and enrolled in the Post-Baccalaureate teaching program. While teaching he attended Southwest Texas State University (now Texas State) where he received his Master of Education degree in Educational Administration. Later, he attended the University of Texas at Austin to work on his Doctorate. He has been an active member both of the Texas Association of School Personnel Administrators (TASPA), where he also served as President, and the Texas Association of School Business Officials (TASBO) where he served many roles including as a Mentor. In addition to teaching and administration certification, Mr. Rodriguez also holds certificates as a Professional Human Capital Leader in Education (pHCLE) and Registered Texas School Business Administrator (RTSBA). He is married to Jenny, a 1st Grade Bilingual Teacher, and together they have two boys, Alfred, a Texas State University Political Science graduate, and Joaquin, a High School Senior.
